content.question:
<math alttext="C u with a positive 2 charge aqueous plus M g solid react to produce C u solid plus M g with a positive 2 charge aqueous. E naught sub cell equals positive 2.71 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>Mg(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>Cu(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="3.0em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2.71</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
A galvanic cell generates a potential of <math alttext="positive 2.71 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2.71</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> when <math alttext="the molar concentration of C u with a positive 2 charge equals the molar concentration of M g with a positive 2 charge, which equals 1 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> based on the chemical reaction represented above. Which of the following provides the best justification that the given conditions can be used to decrease the cell potential <math alttext="where E sub cell is less than positive 2.71 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2.71</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the molar concentration of C u with a positive 2 charge equals the molar concentration of M g with a positive 2 charge, which equals 0.10 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, because equilibrium is approached at a faster rate, causing a decrease in <math alttext="E sub cell" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of C u with a positive 2 charge equals the molar concentration of M g with a positive 2 charge, which equals 2.0 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, because equilibrium is approached at a slower rate, causing a decrease in <math alttext="E sub cell" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of C u with a positive 2 charge equals 1.0 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the molar concentration of M g with a positive 2 charge equals 0.10 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is smaller than 1, making <math alttext="E sub cell" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> decrease.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of C u with a positive 2 charge equals 0.10 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the molar concentration of M g with a positive 2 charge equals 1.0 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than 1, making <math alttext="E sub cell" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> decrease.

content.answer: <math alttext="the molar concentration of C u with a positive 2 charge equals 0.10 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the molar concentration of M g with a positive 2 charge equals 1.0 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than 1, making <math alttext="E sub cell" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> decrease.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
